vision.notes: Guitarfish inhabit tropical, subtropical, and warm temperate waters. Vision is likely used for prey detection and navigation.

electroreception.notes: As rays, guitarfish possess ampullae of Lorenzini for detecting electrical fields, aiding in prey detection (benthic invertebrates and bony fishes) in sandy or muddy environments.

mechanoreception.notes: Lateral line system likely detects water movement and vibrations, useful for detecting predators and prey in their benthic habitat.

chemoreception.notes: Used for detecting chemical cues in the water, potentially aiding in prey localization and mate finding.
